Description: Shoulder fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery krater(?). Tongues above; hindquarters of bull, to left. Dedicatory graffito.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leipzig, Institut für Klassische Archäologie und Antikenmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd was lost in WWII. The provenance is noted by Hogarth et al. 1898-9, 31.
Bibliographic references: Hogarth 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, A. Site and Buildings (p. 55 and pl. IV,no. 51)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (no. 574)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.524)
